name: UpdateWafCustomRule
description:
Update a specific WAF custom rule in Datadog.

Use this tool to update a specific Web Application Firewall (WAF) custom rule in Datadog. It returns the updated custom rule object upon successful execution.

parameters.name: custom_rule_id
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the custom WAF rule to be updated.

value_schema.description: The ID of the custom rule.

parameters.name: waf_custom_rule_definition
parameters.description: JSON object defining the new attributes for the WAF custom rule, including name, conditions, scope, and actions.

action.description: Override the default action to take when the WAF custom rule would block.

location.description: The location to redirect to when the WAF custom rule triggers.

status_code.description: The status code to return when the WAF custom rule triggers.

blocking.description: Indicates whether the WAF custom rule will block the request.

operator.description: Operator to use for the WAF Condition.

data.description: Identifier of a list of data from the denylist. Can only be used as substitution from the list parameter.

address.description: Input from the request on which the condition should apply.

inputs.description: List of inputs on which at least one should match with the given operator.

list.description:
List of value to use with the condition. Only used with the phrase_match, !phrase_match, exact_match and
!exact_match operator.

case_sensitive.description: Evaluate the value as case sensitive.

min_length.description: Only evaluate this condition if the value has a minimum amount of characters.

options.description: Options for the operator of this condition.

regex.description: Regex to use with the condition. Only used with match_regex and !match_regex operator.

value.description: Store the captured value in the specified tag name. Only used with the capture_data operator.

parameters.description: The scope of the WAF custom rule.

conditions.description:
Conditions for which the WAF Custom Rule will triggers, all conditions needs to match in order for the WAF
rule to trigger.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the WAF custom rule is enabled.

name.description: The Name of the WAF custom rule.

path_glob.description: The path glob for the WAF custom rule.

env.description: The environment scope for the WAF custom rule.

service.description: The service scope for the WAF custom rule.

scope.description: The scope of the WAF custom rule.

category.description: The category of the WAF Rule, can be either `business_logic`, `attack_attempt` or `security_response`.

type.description: The type of the WAF rule, associated with the category will form the security activity.

tags.description:
Tags associated with the WAF Custom Rule. The concatenation of category and type will form the security
activity field associated with the traces.

type.description: The type of the resource. The value should always be `custom_rule`.

data.description: Object for a single WAF Custom Rule.

value_schema.description: New definition of the WAF Custom Rule.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.
